medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent episodes of fever up to 39–40°C since 10 months of age.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Episodes typically occurred every 2–3 weeks, lasting for 4–5 days and then spontaneously resolving. Aggravating factors included fever rising above 39°C, with malaise occurring during those times. Symptoms responded better to ibuprofen than acetaminophen.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of recurrent otitis media, treated with tympanostomy tubes at 7 months of age.
medical_history.family_history: Positive for allergic rhinitis and asthma in the father and second-degree relatives; mother is healthy. No family history of periodic fevers.
medical_history.social_history: Does not attend daycare; no siblings.
